channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Bombshell secret road map FINALLY reveals how Melbourne will leave Stage Four lockdown
item.description: Draft documents for the city's exit road map have revealed the government's plan to extend the 8pm-5am curfew and keep restrictions on businesses for an additional two weeks.

item.title: Nancy Pelosi says salon owes her an apology for 'set up'
item.description: Speaker Nancy Pelosi said she fell for a 'set up' by the salon where she was caught on camera having her hair done without wearing a face mask and added the salon owes her an apology.

item.title: Joe Biden tells Donald Trump to 'get off Twitter' and aid schools
item.description: Joe Biden challenged President Trump to 'get off twitter' and meet with Speaker Nancy Pelosi and other congressional leaders to pass emergency funding for schools dealing with the coronavirus.

item.title: Pakistani schoolboy who survived a Taliban massacre is going to Oxford
item.description: Ahmad Nawaz, pictured, was a student at the Army Public School in Peshawar, North West Pakistan when the facility was attacked by the Taliban, some 132 children were massacred.

item.title: CDC instructs states to prepare for COVID-19 vaccines next month
item.description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has instructed US states and territories to prepare for one of two coronavirus vaccines to arrive as early late October, according to the New York Times.

item.title: Donald Trump vows to protect statues on North Carolina visit
item.description: President Donald Trump gave brief remarks Wednesday in Wilmington, North Carolina - a key swing state - designating the city as the first American World War II Heritage City.

item.title: Britt Ekland, 77, describes agony of finding out her grandchild had deadly illness
item.description: Britt, 77, opened up about the the younger of her two grandsons, Lucas (pictured), 3, who has adrenoleukodystrophy a disease that affects one in 15,000 people; boys more severely.

item.title: David Blaine's balloon stunt inspires funny social media memes
item.description: The 47-year-old took to the skies over the Arizona desert on Wednesday, tethered to 52 helium-filled balloons

item.title: United Airlines to start laying off up to 16,000 workers
item.description: The airline, which had previously said as many as 36,000 workers could be terminated, said early retirement and other programs had lessened the need for even deeper cuts.

item.title: Police demand more Tasers as it emerges nine out of 10 officers have been assaulted on duty
item.description: Research from the National Police Chiefs' Council (NPCC) involving 40,000 officers has been released at a time when frontline constables are facing a surge in violence.

item.title: Save Our Shops! Bosses of 80 shopping, dining and hotel chains issue urgent plea to Boris Johnson
item.description: A letter pleading with the Prime Minister for help in getting staff back to the office was signed by more than 80 chief executives, including the heads of Greene King, Pizza Express and Caffe Nero.

item.title: Children are back at school but unions are threatening to hobble universities, writes DAVID BLUNKETT
item.description: DAVID BLUNKETT: After six long months , our children are finally returning to school and that news has cheered me enormously. Initial reports suggest attendance rates are high.
item.media:credit: Jamie Wiseman for The Daily Mail

item.title: Angela Merkel is trapped by a murderous dictator, writes MARK ALMOND
item.description: MARK ALMOND: For a politician who stands accused of pulling her punches when it comes to the various acts of Putin at home and abroad, Angela Merkel had a shock for her critics yesterday.

item.title: A record 409 migrants make it across Channel to UK in one day
item.description: A total of 30 boats are believed to have made the crossing, the first setting off in the early hours of Wednesday, amid 'absolute mayhem' in the world's busiest shipping lane.

item.title: Premier League clubs set to DITCH Black Lives Matter badges on their sleeves when top flight returns
item.description: EXCLUSIVE BY MATT HUGHES: All 20 clubs showed their support for the global campaign by carrying the BLM logo on their kit during every game of Project Restart.

item.title: People who drink just ONE bottle of beer or a small wine each day are 25% more likely to be obese
item.description: Moderate drinking is often regarded as safe by health chiefs. But the latest study from South Korea suggests even this level of drinking can lead to obesity, high blood pressure or diabetes.

item.title: Woman killed by Corfu speedboat 'waved to get driver's attention'
item.description: Claire Glatman, 60, died when she was hit by a speedboat which failed to stop on Monday as she was swimming off Avlaki beach on the north of the Greek holiday island.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle announced they've signed deal with Netflix for undisclosed sum
item.description: Prince Harry, 35, and Meghan Markle, 39, have signed a mega Netflix deal, which will pay them to make documentaries, docu-series, feature films, scripted shows and children's programming.

item.title: Met Police have so far arrested 232 Extinction Rebellion activists since 3,000 flooded capital
item.description: Several activists had to be cleared from the road in Westminster where they had been lying down in an attempt to block Mr Johnson's route to Prime Minister's Questions.

item.title: Calls for coronavirus testing at airports grow
item.description: John Holland-Kaye's (pictured) comments came as the London airport announced it may have to axe up to 1,200 frontline staff due to the pandemic's impact on air travel.

item.title: Kim Kardashian and Kylie Jenner feature in odd Kanye West video
item.description: A bizarre three year old music video for Kanye West's track Feel Me features a scene where Kim Kardashian seemingly gives birth to an adult Kylie Jenner was leaked on Wednesday

item.title: Scottish holidaymakers blame behaviour of 'drunken louts from Zante'
item.description: All passengers arriving in Scotland from 4am on Thursday will have to self-isolate for 14 days amid fears that partying youngsters on the island are rife with the virus.

item.title: STEPHEN GLOVER: Never mind Covid and Brexit, PM faces a bigger challenge - losing Scotland from UK
item.description: STEPHEN GLOVER: There is a possibility of a No Deal Brexit, which would lead in the short term to thousands of lorries queueing in Kent as the French imposed tariffs.

item.title: Brutal torture methods are revealed in Amnesty report on 'Iranian interrogation tactics'
item.description: Demonstrations erupted across Iran in November 2019, but arrested protesters were punished with brutal torture methods used to force confessions from them, Amnesty International has claimed.

item.title: Former Italian premier Berlusconi tests positive for Covid
item.description: Berlusconi is currently isolated at his Arcore residence near Milan, his office said, adding that he will continue to work from there as he completes the necessary quarantine period.

item.title: ROBERT HARDMAN is delighted the BBC has reversed decision over the Proms
item.description: ROBERT HARDMAN: Tim Davie has simply listened to a national chorus, led by this newspaper. He has told the managers of the Proms concerts to put the traditional words back into the traditional finale.

item.title: New BBC boss Tim Davie is lauded for reversing Last Night of the Proms decision
item.description: On Tim Davie's second day as Director General, the BBC yesterday performed a U-turn and brought back the singing of Rule Britannia and Land of Hope and Glory at Last Night of the Proms.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Local anger over Manchester U-turn
item.description: Labour's mayor of Manchester Andy Burnham urged the government to hand over control of the Track and Trace system to local councils following today's latest U-turn.

item.title: Boris Johnson has lost a few belt notches... and his oomph: HENRY DEEDES watches PMQs
item.description: HENRY DEEDES: First PMQs of the new term and Boris Johnson was, I'm sorry to say, poor. Provocatively poor. And it wasn't just that he hadn't bothered with any of the necessary reading.

item.title: £30,000 raised to bring ill woman back to UK from Turkey
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Stephanie Uyar has thanked Good Samaritans who raised £30,000 to help her mother get home from Turkey after she collapsed while on holiday three weeks ago.

item.title: Canada REJECTS asylum request from late North Korean ruler Kim Jong-il's bodyguard
item.description: Lee Young-guk (pictured above in 2016), 57, who defencted to South Korea after spending 10 years as a bodyguard for late ruler Kim Jong-il (inset), has been denied asylum in Canada.

item.title: High Court signs off on Virgin Atlantic £1.2bn private rescue
item.description: At a remote court hearing on Wednesday, Mr Justice Snowden sanctioned the restructuring plan - a key step of the process for Virgin Atlantic to implement the rescue package.

item.title: HANNAH BETTS argues being called a 'B****' should be considered a badge of honour
item.description: Hannah is full of praise for the celebrity real estate agent Christine Quinn, 31, in Netflix's smash-hit Selling Sunset. She argues Christine's real forte is telling it how it is.

item.title: University lecturer takes stunning images of space from garden
item.description: Russell Discombe, 32, from Cirencester, Gloucestershire, bought a star tracker and telescope to locate the 'deep sky' objects - some up to 50 million light-years away.

item.title: House prices are soaring and homes are selling in record time but experts say they'll crash
item.description: Experts are warning the current 'seller's paradise' housing market could soon come crashing back down to earth as more people lose their jobs and feel the economic effects of the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: TOM LEONARD: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's Netflix deal is a repeat of Barack Obama's bonanza
item.description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex - a former actress, let's not forget - were always going to be casting an appreciative eye at what Hollywood had to offer.

item.title: Covid turned us into neat-freaks, but for some germaphobes their obsession is wrecking relationships
item.description: Ally Hall, 43, from Cambridgeshire, never went out without her disposable gloves, antibacterial gel and a mini bottle of Dettol, even before Covid.

item.title: The Femail Face-off: Should reality TV stars plug Test and Trace for cash?
item.description: The Femail face-off debates the use of TV stars to spread a warning.. Yes says Julie Burchill: 'Buffed boys and bombshells can grab our attention'. Melanie Mcdonagh says no.

item.title: From red carpet to real life...SUSANNA REID: Am I the only one baffled by back to school rules?
item.description: Susanna says she is confused by the mangled mess of the details of the return to the classroom. A friend messaged her to say she wasn't even sure which day her daughter was going back.

item.title: Boris Johnson slammed after U-turn on Bolton and Trafford lockdowns
item.description: Bolton and Trafford were among a series of areas in the North West due to see restrictions eased today, but the move was ditched at the last moment.

item.title: Cult of misogyny poisoning minds: LAURA BATES discovers boys are being brainwashed to hate women
item.description: Laura was told 'Why should I believe you' by a boy during a school session about gender, sexual violence and consent after she had discussed her experience of being assaulted.

item.title: Woman's potential Tinder date sent her FATHER revenge porn
item.description: The woman is not named but she filed a lawsuit in Manhattan against Jeffrey Berger seeking $1million in defamation damages.

item.title: Generosity makes you look more attractive, says scientist
item.description: A new analysis of several large studies shows that people who are generous are viewed as more attractive, even when the observer has no information on their giving behavior.

item.title: Dog owner punches his cocker spaniel in horrific attack
item.description: Gregory Phillips, 40, was filmed violently handling and striking his dog on Pentre Street, Glynneath, South Wales, and a 12-month community order and told to undertake 150 hours of unpaid work.

item.title: Jeff Bezos' ex-wife MacKenzie Scott becomes the world's richest woman after Amazon shares surged
item.description: MacKenzie Scott, who owns a 4 percent stake in Amazon after her 2019 divorce from Bezos, now has a net worth of $67.4 billion, according to Bloomberg Billionaires Index.

item.title: Chadwick Boseman: Final text to Black Panther producer shared
item.description: The Marvel star sadly passed away from colon cancer aged 43 on Friday after fighting a secret battle, all while continuing to work and devoting his time to visiting sick kids in hospital.

item.title: US government deficit set to hit record $3.3 trillion this year
item.description: The Congressional Budget Office published its latest report on federal deficits and debt on Wednesday.

item.title: Gymshark mocked for 'virtue signalling' Black History Month post
item.description: The British sportswear giant posted on Instagram 'Black stories matter' and that the brand wanted to 'celebrate and educate' during October.

item.title: Boris Johnson and Saudi Crown Prince discuss Yemen civil war
item.description: The Prime Minister (pictured) stressed the importance of the UK's relationship with the desert kingdom during the conversation with Mohammed bin Salman.

item.title: John Boyega hits out at Disney's treatment of his Star Wars character
item.description: The actor, 28, told British GQ how he thinks Disney marketed his character as being 'much more important' to the franchise than he actually was.

item.title: Trump told Sarah Sanders to 'take one for the team!' after Kim Jong-un 'winked' at her in 2018
item.description: Donald Trump joked that Sarah Sanders would need to 'take one for the team' after Kim Jong-un 'winked' at her during the Singapore summit, the former press secretary reveals in her new book.

item.title: UK announces 10 more coronavirus deaths
item.description: The 1,508 new cases confirmed in the UK today mark the third highest figure since June 14, after 1,715 on Sunday, August 30, and 1,522 last Thursday, August 27.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's visit to LA preschool is questioned by parents
item.description: Parents have questioned Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's visit to a LA preschool on Monday - with some saying they aren't allowed to enter their children's schools due to Covid-19 policy.

item.title: Woke brigade slam BBC's Proms U-turn on Rule Britannia
item.description: The woke brigade have slammed the BBC's announcement that Land of Hope and Glory and Rule, Britannia! will both be sung at the Last Night of the Proms as a 'pathetic climb down'.

item.title: Two teenage killers, 18 and 16, who tried to decapitate factory worker with a Samurai sword jailed
item.description: Two schoolboys have been jailed for life for the 100-blow Samurai sword murder of factory supervisor Robert Wilson. Kiyran Earnshaw, 18, and Luke Gaukroger, 16, were sentenced in Leeds

item.title: Germany says Alexei Navalny was poisoned with Novichok
item.description: Navalny remains in a coma in a Berlin hospital nearly two weeks after collapsing on a plane in Siberia in what German medics suspect was a poisoning.

item.title: Cabinet minister Therese Coffey hints taxes should be CUT in the Budget
item.description: Chancellor Rishi Sunak revealed his tough message to MPs as he failed to cover up a sheaf of speaking notes while leaving Downing Street.

item.title: Data specialist recruited to civil service after Cummings' call for 'weirdos and misfits' is sacked
item.description: Will O'Shea (pictured), 57, who was a data architecture and governance specialist in the Cabinet Office from April, lost his job after the tweet.

item.title: Trains out of London King's Cross to Edinburgh, Leeds, Lincoln and Bradford are cancelled
item.description: All trains out of London's Kings Cross were cancelled at around 5.30pm this afternoon after damage to an overhead electric wires in Biggleswade, Bedfordshire.

item.title: Chinese text from 2,000 years ago about 'pathways' in the human body are the oldest anatomical text
item.description: Manuscripts created 2,000 years ago were discovered in an ancient Chinese tomb in 1973. Experts have finally interpreted the text, revealing the world's oldest anatomical atlas - 're-writing China's history.'

item.title: Restaurant owner rebuffs customer who complained about 12 minute wait and threatened to SLAP him
item.description: The owner of the Gatehouse Steakhouse in Dolgellau, Snowdonia, was shocked when a customer threatened to slap them and leave them a bad TripAdvisor review over a 12 minute wait.

item.title: Widow of PC Andrew Harper says Priti Patel and Robert Buckland 'are really on board' with campaign
item.description: Lissie Harper met with Priti Patel and Robert Buckland earlier today to discuss her campaign for harsher sentences for criminals who kill emergency workers, after the death of PC Andrew Harper.

item.title: Illusionist David Blaine launches balloon flight stunt
item.description: Illusionist and magician David Blaine's 'Ascension' balloon stunt kicked off in Page, Arizona on Wednesday morning.

item.title: Burberry is awarded £573,000 government contract to make PPE for the NHS
item.description: Luxury fashion house Burberry earned praise from Health Secretary Matt Hancock in April after retooled its Yorkshire site to produce around 160,000 pieces of PPE for healthcare workers.
item.media:description: Burberry said it has donated 100,000 items of PPE (Yui Mok/PA)

item.title: Quantum breakthrough paves way for safer online communication
item.description: The University of Bristol's 'multiplexing' system splits light particles emitted by hardware that carry information to multiple internet users.

item.title: WWI replica British biplane crashes during mock dogfight with German aircraft at aerodrome
item.description: Pilot Matthew Boddington struggled with control for the Royal Aircraft Factory BE2c above Sywell aerodrome in Nottinghamshire this morning before his forced landing.

item.title: Iron on the Moon is RUSTING due to oxygen blown in on solar winds from Earth
item.description: The oxidised iron mineral hematite - a form of rusted iron - was discovered at high latitudes on the Moon by planetary scientists from the University of Hawaii.

item.title: Bering Sea 'has less ice than at any time in the last 5,500 years'
item.description: Analysis of vegetation from St Matthew Island off the coast of Alaska shows sea ice in the region was last this low at the end of the Stone Age, or before the reign of the pharoahs.

item.title: Children that spend more than two hours a day watching TV 'lose four months of schooling'
item.description: The analysis by the Murdoch Children's Research Institute in Melbourne also revealed no links between use of videogames and academic performance.

item.title: Woman says her breast implants made her so sick she thought she was DYING
item.description: Kelley McConnell, 38, from Wrightstown, Pennsylvania, struggled with breast implant illness for 10 years after undergoing breast augmentation in 2006.

item.title: Ex-footballer Richard Rufus charged with alleged currency fraud
item.description: Ex Charlton Athletic defender Richard Rufus, 45, pictured, from Crystal Palace in London will stand trial at a new Nightingale court in Southwark in March 2021.

item.title: Chilled man laughs and jokes as a nurse shark which has bitten down on his arm refuses to let go
item.description: Large crowds gathered to catch a glimpse of a nursing shark sinking its strong jaw and serrated teeth into a man's arm on Jense Beach, Florida, but footage shows he remained very composed.

item.title: Bay City Rollers star Ian Mitchell dies as band say they are 'deeply saddened' at his death
item.description: Ian Mitchell joined the Bay City Rollers in 1976, aged 17, replacing bassist Alan Longmuir - but left after just seven months with the Scots group, dubbed as 'tartan teen sensations'.

item.title: Mercedes' S-Class will be one of the first cars to offer hands-free UK driving
item.description: The luxury limousine has a feature called Drive Pilot, which will allow for automated driving on UK motorways if the new rules are passed.

item.title: Trainee lawyer, 25, praises 'gentlemen' Chris Eubank and David Haye for coming to her rescue
item.description: Armandine Pohecoula, 25, was struck by the car on the Albert Embankment on her way home to south London on Tuesday when the two champion boxers rushed to her aid.

item.title: Vatican seeks to stop Mafia using 'hijacked' Virgin Mary symbol
item.description: Pope Francis offered Father Stefano Cecchin, the President of the Pontifical International Marian Academy, his support in working against the Italian mafia.

item.title: Pentagon and Google work on tool to identify cancer in veterans
item.description: The model, called Predictive Health, will identify tumors and help pathologists learn its genetic profile and structure, which could lower costs and lessen workload.

item.title: Elon Musk says there is a 'good chance you'll die' on Mars during a virtual summit
item.description: Elon Musk spoke at a virtual summit about SpaceX's plans to colonize Mars, saying getting there is not the problem but the potential dangers settlers will face will be the biggest hurdle.

item.title: Heathrow is set to axe up a QUARTER of its frontline staff with up to 1,200 roles at risk
item.description: London's Heathrow Airport could axe up to 1,200 jobs, around a quarter of its frontline roles, as a result of a downturn in the industry due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: UK housing market 'bounces back' with biggest monthly rise in 16 years
item.description: British house-buyers have shrugged off continued uncertainty in the economy and social distancing with August seeing a 2% rise in prices, the biggest monthly jump since February 2004.

item.title: North Korea's nuclear activity is 'serious concern', UN fears
item.description: A UN watchdog report claims North Korea is continuing its nuclear research despite international restrictions which prevent it from doing so.

item.title: Facing the front and paying attention! Pupils go back to sitting in rows and facing the teacher
item.description: Millions of children returned to school today and the classrooms of old - as new coronavirus safety rules mean they have to now sit in rows again and face their teacher.

item.title: Nigella Lawson shares her top tip for making the perfect crispy fries without a trace of grease
item.description: Nigella Lawson has impressed her Instagram fans with her recipe for Tuscan fries. The British TV chef, 60, said using cold oil is the secret - and it's less stressful than traditional deep-frying.

item.title: McDonald's is launching FOUR new menu items today
item.description: Available in all UK stores today alongside the previously announced Triple Cheeseburger is the 99p Jam Muffin as well as a Dairy Milk McFlurry and a Cadbury Caramel McFlurry.

item.title: FEMAIL takes a look back at the life of Strictly star, Nicola Adams
item.description: Following the news that Nicola Adams, 37, will make history as part of the first same-sex pairing on Strictly Come Dancing, FEMAIL takes a look into the life of the double Olympian.

item.title: Woman dies from cancer after having baby early to get treatment
item.description: A mum who had her IVF baby three months early so she could begin treatment for cancer has died. Gemma Collins, from Northumberland, was diagnosed with sarcoma while pregnant.

item.title: Adorable moment MP's baby starts crying during an Education Committee video call
item.description: Stoke Conservative MP Jonathan Gullis, 30, appeared on the video call along with his newborn. At first, the baby appeared to be settled, but Amelia soon made her presence known when she cried.

item.title: Widely-used and cheap steroid hydrocortisone can cut coronavirus deaths by a THIRD
item.description: An analysis by University of Bristol of seven different studies found three steroids reduce the risk of death in critically ill Covid-19 patients by 20%, which bumped up to 31% for hydrocortisone.

item.title: Two Royal Mail postmen, 55 and 59, died on their rounds during the August heatwave
item.description: Mark Cremer, 55, from Sussex, and 59-year-old Phil Bentham, from Cumbria, are said to have died on their routes in mid-August, as temperatures in the UK soared beyond 34 degrees.

item.title: Shocking moment car thieves steal screaming couple's Audi after arriving on moped
item.description: Video footage from a Ring doorbell camera shows a white Audi rolling into a driveway in Purley, Greater London at around 3.45pm on August 15 before two car thieves steal the vehicle.

item.title: Holidays in 2070: Futurist predicts how people will holiday in 50 years' time
item.description: Futurist Tom Cheesewright has examined how the major changes in how people might be living and working in 50 years' time will reshape what taking a holiday means in the year 2070.

item.title: London's vast array of bike lanes lie empty
item.description: Photographs taken in recent days across London in the likes of Tooting, Balham, and Islington showed how the new lanes were empty while cars and vans sat in heavy traffic alongside them.

item.title: PSG star Neymar 'tests POSITIVE for coronavirus' after an end of season holiday in Ibiza
item.description: The world's most expensive footballer is one of three players at the beaten Champions League finalists Paris Saint-Germain to have tested positive.

item.title: Ofqual chief says adopting results algorithm was a 'fundamental mistake'
item.description: Roger Taylor told MPs that earlier this year the regulator had made clear to Mr Williamson that it believed the best way forward was for exams to go ahead 'in a socially distanced manner'.

item.title: Trial of alleged Charlie Hebdo terror accomplices begins in Paris
item.description: Police led the defendants into a packed courtroom in Paris where they will answer charges of supplying weapons and financing terrorists. (Pictured: Defendants in the dock)

item.title: Rare photographs showing Elvis Presley holding baby daughter and riding a horse go up for auction
item.description: A collection of never-before-seen images of the King of Rock 'n' Roll have been unearthed ahead of an auction where they will be sold. The photos were taken in the late 1960s and early 1970s

item.title: Ex-policeman who abducted schoolgirl, 15, and her friend wins battle to become a taxi driver
item.description: Imran Ali's application to Sefton Council in Merseyside was initially turned down earlier this year but magistrates yesterday reversed the decision, describing him as 'fit and proper'.

item.title: Teenagers who perceive their parents to be loving and supportive are less likely to be cyberbullies
item.description: NYU study revealed youths with parents who are 'almost always' loving are six times less likely to be cyberbullies than those who say their parents are 'almost never' loving towards them.

item.title: Boris Johnson is branded 'heartless' for declining to meet Covid bereaved
item.description: The Prime Minister said 'of course I will meet the bereaved' when questioned last week in an interview about attempts by the Covid-19 Bereaved Families for Justice group to secure a meeting.

item.title: Weekly coronavirus deaths drop below 100 for the first time in five months
item.description: A total of 88 people died from the disease in in England and Wales in the week ending August 21, according to the ONS. It's the first time weekly Covid fatalities have dipped to double digits since March.

item.title: Adorable shot shows little boy waving goodbye to his toys as he heads to the first day of school
item.description: Sean Donnelly, 32, from Loughborough, collected all his son's favourite toys and lined them up in the doorway to say 'goodbye' to his four-year-old son, Vinny, as he headed to the first day of class.

item.title: Furious Glaswegians slam ban on indoor visits while pubs and restaurants remain open
item.description: Since midnight 800,000 people living in the Glasgow, West Dunbartonshire and East Renfrewshire areas have been slapped back into a partial lockdown.

item.title: Madeleine McCann prime suspect Christian Brueckner draws pencil sketch of his cramped prison cell
item.description: The drawing has emerged as police continue to investigate his role in the three-year-old's disappearance in Portugal in 2007.

item.title: University of Oxford is ranked best in the world for FIFTH year in a row
item.description: Experts warn coronavirus heralds 'a perfect storm' of huge challenges for UK universities who risk losing international student fee income and the global flow of academic talent to institutions.

item.title: Jeremy Hunt says he 'dodged a bullet' by losing to Boris Johnson in Tory leadership race
item.description: Jeremy Hunt had been in the running to succeed Theresa May as Britain's Prime Minister last year, but won just half the number of votes Boris Johnson did - a loss he now seems thankful for.

item.title: Michel Barnier issues Brexit trade deal warning over fishing rights
item.description: The bloc's chief Brexit negotiator said he is 'worried and disappointed' after informal discussions with UK counterpart David Frost this week ended in failure.

item.title: 'There is no sign of a second wave': Experts rubbish Matt Hancock's warning
item.description: Scientists say expansion of testing means more infections are being found, after Health Secretary Matt Hancock yesterday warned that the UK 'must do everything in our power' to prevent a second wave.

item.title: Facebook takes down Russian-operated troll network targeting UK democracy
item.description: Facebook has removed a network of fake accounts and pages originating in Russia which targeted Jeremy Corbyn supporters with fake news content.

item.title: Killer beat his mum to death then went to the local RSL before returning and bashing her again
item.description: Boutros Mouawad, 57, has pleaded guilty to manslaughter after his mother Helen Mouwad, 76, was found dead in the backyard of her home in Woonona, south of Sydney in February 2019.

item.title: Prince Charles and Camilla unveil 'special recipe' for traditional Scottish oatcakes
item.description: Prince Charles, 71, and Camilla, 73, have unveiled a 'special recipe' for traditional Scottish oatcakes as part of an online 'taste tour across the UK' to celebrate their royal work.

item.title: Monster black hole 150 times heavier than the Sun detected using gravitational waves
item.description: Researchers using the LIGO and Virgo gravitational wave detectors spotted a wave with eight times the energy of the Sun coming from 17 billion light years away.

item.title: Manctopia: Billion Pound Property Boom viewers left outraged by developer building 2,000 new homes
item.description: Viewers of BBC's Manctopia: Billion Pound Property Boom last night slammed property developer Tim Heatley as they accused him of having a 'greedy' attitude towards building.

item.title: Boris Johnson hints at part-time rail season tickets to encourage workers back to offices
item.description: Boris Johnson said the government and rail companies were cooperating 'at pace' to develop tickets that can be used a few times a week.

item.title: Schoolboy, 15, 'had sex with married teacher but denied it after she told him she was pregnant'
item.description: The teenager said he had three sexual encounters with 35-year-old Kandice Barber, who is alleged to have sent him a topless photo of herself that was passed around their Buckinghamshire school.

item.title: Disgusting moment diners 'sprinkle pubic hair into food' before refusing to pay for their £70 meal
item.description: CCTV at Jaan's BBQ Kitchen Restaurant and Grill in Blackburn, Lancashire, captured the moment one of the men appeared to reach into his shorts and scatter the supposed hair.

item.title: Coronavirus antibodies last at least four months after infection, largest study to-date finds
item.description: A study of more than 30,000 people in Iceland found that about one percent of the population had been infected, but developed antibodies that become stable after a month or two.
item.media:description: FILE - In this Friday, June 12, 2020 file photo, a woman has blood drawn for COVID-19 antibody testing in Dearborn, Mich. Antibodies that people make to fight coronavirus infection last at least four months and do not fade quickly as some earlier reports suggested -- a good sign that vaccines may be able to give long-lasting immunity, scientists are reporting on Tuesday, Sept. 1, 2020, in the New England Journal of Medicine. (AP Photo/Paul Sancya)

item.title: Furious pensioner, 73, hurls ROCK at company director neighbour
item.description: Company director Alan McTear, 53, from Tavernspite in south-west Wales, was inside a mini-digger laying a new fence when he was confronted by 73-year-old neighbour Christopher Woodward.

item.title: Kyle Rittenhouse's lawyer plans to sue Twitter after account was blocked
item.description: Lin Wood is one of several lawyers representing 17-year-old Kyle Rittenhouse after he was charged with shooting dead two protesters and injuring a third in Kenosha, Wisconsin last week.

item.title: Stunning mansion with banqueting hall that featured in TV's Sherlock on for sale for £1.85million
item.description: This stunning mansion with a banqueting hall that featured in TV series Sherlock is up for sale for a cool £1.85m. The six-storey home in Penarth, near Cardiff, boasts six double bedrooms.

item.title: Prince Philippos of Greece announces engagement to long-term girlfriend
item.description: Prince Philippos of Greece proposed to his long-term girlfriend, creative director for airline VistaJet Nina Nastassja Flohr, during a romantic getaway to the island of Ithaca in Greece this summer.

item.title: Abandoned German Shepard-mix cares for orphaned litter of kittens
item.description: Touching footage shows, Georgia, who was found by volunteers from Sunshine Dog Rescue of Phoenix, Arizona, caring for the kittens after her puppies were born prematurely and died.

item.title: Joe Biden takes leads as high as 11 points in first polls after Republican convention
item.description: Joe Biden has taken the lead in the first polls out after the Republican National Convention as both candidates eye the Midwest as a path to presidential victory.

item.title: Piers Morgan pays an emotional tribute to Life Stories warm-up comedian Ian Royce after his death
item.description: Piers, 55, fondly remembered working with the comedian, 51, who he called 'Roycey', and said he was 'the best funniest warm-up guy there was'.

item.title: Shadowy Russian owner of Beirut's 'floating bomb ship' breaks cover
item.description: Russian-born Igor Grechushkin, 43, owned the 'rust bucket' cargo ship the MV Rhosus, which carried 2,750 tonnes of deadly ammonium nitrate that exploded and ripped through Beirut last month.

item.title: Incredible footage shows moment seal uses the ring pool at the Noboribetsu Marine Park Nixe in Japan
item.description: Noboribetsu Marine Park Nixe in Japan has taken to Twitter to share incredible footage of a seal using the ring pool. The clip shows the marine mammal swimming into the circular fixture.

item.title: Mother loses 4st in lockdown but is left with a flap of excess skin costing £8K to remove
item.description: Laura Painter, 27, from Enfield, north London, said she feels the healthiest she's ever been but the folds of skin across her tummy 'get her down' - and she believes it will cost around £8,000 to get rid.

item.title: Fuming easyJet passengers accuse airline of not cleaning planes properly
item.description: The Farrow family, who were flying from Catania, Italy to Bristol on Monday, shared photos which appeared to show tray tables stained with white marks, and crumbs strewn across the carpet.

item.title: Winter Wonderland in Hyde Park is CANCELLED for the first time in 13 years because of coronavirus
item.description: Winter Wonderland 2020 has been cancelled over coronavirus concerns. Organisers of the Hyde Park event have today revealed that the event would not be going ahead.

item.title: Woman, 25, who met husband, 53, as a teenager insists age is just a number
item.description: Kelsey Kammeyer Allen, 25, from Salt Lake City, Utah, said she and husband Paul Allen, 53, often attract curious stares from strangers when they kiss or hold hands while out in public together.

item.title: Day two of Britain's back to work drive and roads and trains into London look empty
item.description: While some Underground trains were beginning to look busier during rush hour this morning, hardly anyone was to be seen arriving at major terminals in London such as Waterloo and Paddington.

item.title: Tiny fibres from denim jeans found in the Canadian Arctic
item.description: Scientists discovered indigo denim microfibers in North American waters, which are shed during laundering and enter waterways.

item.title: Underwater 'bubble net' between Cuba and Mexico could stop deadly hurricanes
item.description: The bubble net in this area of ocean would serve as a natural 'choke point' for storms on their way to land across the Gulf of Mexico and the bubbles could see the hurricane dissipate before it makes landfall.

item.title: Microsoft unveils new tools to identify deepfake videos
item.description: There were at least 96 'foreign influenced' deep fake campaigns on social media targeting people in 30 countries between 2013 and 2019, according to Microsoft.

item.title: Europe's hospitalisation rates remain low despite soaring cases
item.description: Compared to the height of the coronavirus crisis in the spring, people testing positive now in Spain, France and Germany are typically younger and less likely to die or become seriously ill.

item.title: Thailand's King officially reinstates his mistress as royal consort
item.description: The restoration of Sineenatra Wongvajirabhakdi to the good graces of King Maha Vajiralongkorn was confirmed by an official announcement published in the Royal Gazette.

item.title: British mother, 23, is found dead in her Ibiza hotel room by devastated sister
item.description: Amy Connor, 23, was staying at the Ibiza Rocks Hotel in the resort of San Antonio, where her body was found by her sibling, Toni, 26.

item.title: Gangster who stabbed a man for bumping into him in the street says he never missed uni lectures
item.description: Gabriel Krauze, 34, grew up in South Kilburn and told The Times how he went off the rails at 13, witnessing his first stabbing a year later and walking out on his family altogether at 17.

item.title: Kidnapped Shannon Matthews and her siblings will have lifelong anonymity
item.description: Shannon Matthews was the victim in a faked kidnapping by 'worst mother' Karen Matthews in 2008, who had plotted to pocket a £50,000 reward. She was found 24 days later in West Yorkshire.

item.title: Dominic Cummings moves senior aides into new Nasa-style Whitehall hub
item.description: Dominic Cummings - who ditched his has trademark scruffy style for a smart suit as the new political term started yesterday - has introduced a Nasa-style set-up in the Cabinet Office.

item.title: Gonorrhoea cases have soared 26% in a year to the highest level since records began
item.description: There were 70,936 cases of the sexually transmitted infection in England and Wales last year, the highest number since records began in 1918. It marks a 26 per cent increase from 2018.

item.title: Drink-driving mother who turned to booze in lockdown as she couldn't cope with sons avoids jail
item.description: Jaimie Lewis claimed being in lockdown with her sons drove her to drink and leave Bournemouth home to escape arguing. Lewis was pulled over by police before launching a drunken tirade at officers

item.title: Alastair Campbell says his 'horrific' depression can leave him feeling 'literally dead inside'
item.description: Alastair Campbell, 63, appeared on Lorraine this morning where he said that while he has medication for depression, it can be harder for his partner Fiona, who he lives with in London.

item.title: Rapper Akon reveals plans for the futuristic $6bn city modelled after Black Panther's Wakanda
item.description: The R&B star has laid the first stone for the city in the Atlantic Ocean village of Mbodiene, around 60 miles south of the capital Dakar.

item.title: Russia's bare knuckle boxers: Shocking images reveal gruesome injuries suffered by atheletes
item.description: GRAPHIC CONTENT WARNING: Gruesome images have emerged showing the bloody injuries suffered by bare-knuckle boxers in Russia. The winner receives just £10,000.

item.title: French urbanites embrace £5,000 Citroen electric cube car
item.description: Citroen Ami, which can be driven by kids as young as 14 who have passed a moped test, has received rave reviews since it hit Parisian streets in March.

item.title: Tourist, 24, drowns off Corfu days after a mother-of-four was killed by a speedboat propeller
item.description: The man, who is yet to be identified, was swimming several hundred feet from the shore of Kerasia beach in northeastern Corfu yesterday, when he was seen struggling in the water.

item.title: Google will ramp up advertising fees on firms from the UK, Austria and Turkey by up to 5%
item.description: From November, companies from the UK, Austria and Turkey which promote themselves on the tech giant's platforms, such as Google Ads and YouTube, will face increased fees.

item.title: Pregnant woman, 24, is murdered and her unborn child cut out of her womb
item.description: The woman has been identified locally as Flavia Godinho Mafra, who was 36 weeks pregnant when she was murdered in the town of Canelinha, in the southern Brazilian state of Santa Catarina.

item.title: TikTok user reveals the grim gunk that could be lurking in YOUR kitchen sink
item.description: Natasha Witts, from Caversham, Berkshire, shared a horrifying video of the grime lurking under her plug hole on TikTok as a warning to people with smelly sinks in their kitchen or bathroom.

item.title: Welsh ridicule Met Office for choosing Heulwen as name for storm which translates as 'sun blessed'
item.description: Next season's storm names are confirmed and Storm Heulwen has been included as the eighth name but Welsh speakers have pointed out the name literally translates to 'sunshine'.

item.title: Youth minister, 44, who slapped reporter's behind on live TV pleads guilty to sexual battery
item.description: Thomas Callaway, 44, was sentenced to a year probation and fined $1,000 by a Savannah, Georgia, judge who accepted his plea for the misdemeanor count on Tuesday. He also got community service.

item.title: Elvis Presley's Graceland is defaced by vandals who spray-painted 'BLM' on wall of King's mansion
item.description: The protest slogans were painted in thick black and orange lettering on the stone wall that surrounds the King of Rock and Roll's Graceland mansion along Elvis Presley Boulevard,

item.title: Priti Patel to review sentencing for killing police after meeting with PC Andrew Harper's widow
item.description: Priti Patel will meet with Lissie Harper, the widow of PC Andrew Harper (both pictured) later today, as she campaigns for stricter sentences for criminals who kill officers following her husband's death.

item.title: Downing Street plans new digital ID cards for British citizens
item.description: Britons will get an online identity that can be used for daily activities such as proving ones age, registering with a GP and buying properties from a different location. Pictured: Dominic Cummings.

item.title: Footage shows Kenosha gunman Kyle Rittenhouse 'punching a girl several times during argument '
item.description: The footage was captured in Downtown Kenosha on July 1 - just weeks before 17-year-old Kyle Rittenhouse would shoot dead two Black Lives Matter protesters with an AR-15

item.title: Mask-wearing priest collapses and dies at the pulpit while giving a sermon at his church in Cameroon
item.description: Catholic priest Rev. Father Jude can be seen wearing a face mask, speaking to his congregation from the pulpit, when he falls to the ground in Cameroon's western city of Douala during Sunday Mass.

item.title: 'Disturbing' dream leads to soul singer Len Coley seeking Australian lover he abandoned 44 years ago
item.description: Len Coley placed an advertisement in a Sydney newspaper last weekend in the hope of finding the woman he loved and lost in the mid-1970s after dreaming of her for the first time since they parted.

item.title: People reveal the VERY creative makeshift inventions they've made to tackle everyday problems
item.description: When faced with a problem, these people from across the globe have definitely risen to the challenge. The handy hacks have been collated in a photo gallery by Bored Panda.

item.title: Singletons share the VERY brutal responses they've given to hopeful suitors
item.description: These hilarious screenshots, collated by Bored Panda from across the world, show that some sassy singletons are always prepared with the perfect withering put-downs.

item.title: Can YOU find the queen bee among her colony in this tricky puzzle?
item.description: Hungarian children's illustrator and viral puzzle sensation Gergely Dudás, better known as Dudolf, recently shared the seek-and-find puzzle on his website and Facebook page for fans to enjoy.

item.title: Donald Trump praises First Lady Melania's style, class and grace
item.description: 'They like her, they love her style, her class, her grace,' Donald Trump said when asked by Fox News host Laura Ingraham about Melania's appeal to female voters across the country.

item.title: Acclaimed self-help author Fiori Giovanni is accused of leaving her baby alone in the bath
item.description: A best selling author charged with the child homicide of her seven-month-old daughter had allegedly left her alone in the bath.

item.title: Teenage boy, 17, is charged with the murder of the former Twelve Tribes religious sect leader
item.description: Chen Czarnecki died in a blaze that police alleged was deliberately lit at Smiths Creek property in northern New South Wales at about 5.45pm on Sunday 16 August.
